author: Jonah E. Bromwich, William K. Rashbaum, Michael S. Schmidt, Santul Nerkar and Maggie Haberman
description: Maurene Comey, who is the daughter of the former F.B.I. director James Comey, worked on the criminal cases against Jeffrey Epstein and his associate Ghislaine Maxwell.
title: Manhattan Prosecutor Who Handled Epstein Cases Is Fired

author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
description: In a visit to Pennsylvania, Vice President JD Vance stressed tax cuts and savings accounts for newborns, with no mention of trims to Medicaid and nutritional assistance programs many Trump voters rely on.
title: Vance Tries to Sell the Benefits of Trump’s Megabill but Ignores the Costs

author: Miguel Salazar
description: A poet and memoirist as well, she drew a wide readership with her historical fiction, notably with a Civil War-era tale that was adapted for a movie starring Tom Hanks.
title: Paulette Jiles, 82, Dies; Novelist Evoked the West in ‘News of the World’

author: Luis Ferré-Sadurní
description: The detentions have become a relatively easy way for Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents to detain immigrants who are appearing for court dates.
title: Immigrants File Class-Action Lawsuit to Stop ICE Courthouse Arrests

author: Alan Feuer
description: The exchanges unfolded at a hearing in Federal District Court in Nashville intended to determine whether Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia should be freed from criminal custody as he awaits trial.
title: Lawyers for Kilmar Abrego Garcia Question Evidence in Criminal Case

author: Jeffery C. Mays, Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Urvashi Uberoy
description: Mayor Eric Adams reported raising $1.5 million over the last month, but his inability to qualify for matching funds may hamper his re-election bid.
title: Adams Eclipses Mamdani in Recent Fund-Raising, as Cuomo Lags Behind

author: Shawn Hubler
description: Thousands of National Guard members have served in the L.A. region since last month. Six soldiers spoke in interviews about low morale over the deployment.
title: Trump’s National Guard Troops Are Questioning Their Mission in L.A.

author: Neil Vigdor
description: Billy McFarland, who served nearly four years in prison for fraud, said in April that he would put the beleaguered brand that he founded up for sale.
title: Scandal-Ridden Fyre Festival Is Sold for $245,000 on eBay

author: Colby Smith and Tony Romm
description: The Trump administration is toying with removing Jerome H. Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve, accusing him of mismanaging a multibillion-dollar update to its Washington headquarters.
title: Can Trump Fire Powell? He Likely Lacks Case to Remove Fed Chair, Experts Say.

author: Asher Elbein
description: The price paid for the juvenile specimen of the 150-million-year old predatory dinosaur is the third-highest on record.
title: Ceratosaur Fossil Auctioned for $30.5 Million by Sotheby’s

author: Alan Feuer
description: The judge on Long Island chided the Trump administration over its effort to “avoid public scrutiny.”
title: Judge Chastises U.S. Over Secrecy in Moving to Drop Charges Against MS-13 Leader

author: Michael Crowley
description: Republicans on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee said the changes were needed and called the outrage overblown.
title: Senate Democrats Rail at ‘Sloppy, Rushed’ State Dept. Firings

author: Jennifer Medina, Melanie Bencosme, Leila Medina and James Surdam
description: Jennifer Medina, a political reporter at The New York Times who is based in Los Angeles, speaks with a witness who recorded an immigration raid near a Home Depot.
title: Documenting L.A.’s Surge in Immigration Arrests

author: Rick Rojas
description: Prosecutors said the chiefs and other officials exploited a program that offers immigrant victims of violent crime a pathway to residency and citizenship.
title: Louisiana Police Chiefs Accused of Fabricating Robberies in Immigrant Visa Scheme

author: David Wallace-Wells
description: More than a client list, MAGA is looking for meaning.
title: The Epstein Story Is Both Conspiracy Theory and Genuine Scandal

author: Clyde Haberman
description: On assignment for U.P.I. in Cuba, he learned of the U.S.- backed effort to overthrow Fidel Castro and was imprisoned. He later worked for The New York Times.
title: Henry Raymont, First to Report Bay of Pigs Invasion, Dies at 98

author: Ruth Igielnik
description: Few Americans have confidence in the chairman, Jerome Powell, to do the right thing on the economy, though attitudes are deeply partisan.
title: Public Views of the Fed Chair Are Polarized as Trump Mulls His Firing

author: Patricia Mazzei and Hamed Aleaziz
description: Several immigrant detainees described high tension and anxiety at the remote, hastily constructed facility over a lack of information, recreation and access to medication.
title: The Chaotic Early Days Inside Florida’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ Detention Center

author: Thomas L. Friedman
description: Mamdani is pulled between his supporters and his critics on the phrase “globalize the intifada.”
title: Mamdani, Be a Convener, Not a Commentator

author: Alan Rappeport
description: The law is creating backlash from the gambling industry and bettors who could owe taxes even if they break even.
title: Republican Tax Bill Is a Losing Deal for Gamblers

author: Andrew Duehren
description: Tucked into the huge set of tax cuts that Republicans passed into law this month was the expansion of an unusually valuable tax break for start-up investors.
title: How Republicans Supersized Silicon Valley’s Favorite Tax Break

author: Richard Sandomir
description: He won a Pulitzer Prize in 1993, and was a finalist four times while at The Arizona Republic. Some of his work rankled his own Mormon community.
title: Steve Benson, Provocative Editorial Cartoonist, Dies at 71

author: Mark Walker
description: Colorado led the country in bank robberies, per capita, for three years starting in 2021. Law enforcement officials found innovative ways to crack the crime wave.
title: Nicknames, Notes and a Waddle: How Colorado Fought a Bank Robbery Surge

author: Maggie Haberman and Colby Smith
description: The president waved a copy of a draft letter firing Jerome H. Powell at a meeting in the Oval Office with House Republicans. It remains to be seen whether he follows through with his threat.
title: Trump Has Penned Letter To Fire Fed Chair Jerome Powell

author: Catie Edmondson and Andrew Duehren
description: The president’s marquee policy legislation is best known for slashing taxes and cutting social safety net programs. But the sweeping measure also included many little-noticed goodies and add-ons.
title: Rum, Fisheries and a Sculpture Garden: The Quiet Winners in Trump’s Big Bill

author: Jane Black
description: In polarized Washington, Ama is drawing leaders from both camps with an anti-additive menu and a vow to bar all manner of toxicity.
title: Is This Restaurant the Only Thing Democrats and Republicans Agree On?

author: Jonah E. Bromwich, William K. Rashbaum and Maia Coleman
description: Thomas G. Donlon, who served only weeks, said in a lawsuit that New York’s mayor and top department officials had manipulated the system for personal and political gain.
title: Ex-Commissioner Sues, Saying Adams Ran N.Y.P.D. as a Criminal Enterprise

author: Peter Baker
description: The president’s vilification of political opponents and journalists seeds the ground for threats of prosecution, imprisonment and deportation unlike any modern president has made.
title: For Trump, Domestic Adversaries Are Not Just Wrong, They Are ‘Evil’

author: Rob Copeland
description: Goldman and other investment banks are feeding off a Trump boom.
title: Goldman Sachs Sets Series of Records on Tariff Swings

author: Jessica Grose
description: Their moderation has been misread.
title: Why We Mistake the Wholesomeness of Gen Z for Conservatism

author: Jeanna Smialek
description: The European Union is racing to clinch an agreement with the Americans before tariffs kick in on Aug. 1, even as President Trump has signaled he is in no rush.
title: Europe Rushes to Negotiate a Trade Deal as Trump’s Team Voices Indifference

author: Ana Swanson and Alexandra Stevenson
description: Details are still scarce on the agreement, which the president said will partly walk back some of the steep tariffs he threatened on the country last week.
title: Trump Announces ‘Great Deal’ on Trade With Indonesia

author: Tom Wright-Piersanti
description: We look at recent flooding — and explain what you can do to stay safe.
title: Flood Season

author: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Elian Peltier
description: Plus, why that e-book cost your library $50.
title: Rising Inflation, and the Supreme Court’s ‘Shadow Docket’

author: Adam Liptak
description: In a series of terse, unsigned orders, the court has often been giving the green light to President Trump’s agenda without a murmur of explanation.
title: Supreme Court Keeps Ruling in Trump’s Favor, but Doesn’t Say Why

author: The Editorial Board
description: Abandoning local public radio and TV would accelerate a dangerous trend straining civic health.
title: Public Media Can Be a Lifeline. Gutting It Hurts Everyone.

author: Ben Casselman
description: Economists say it will take time for the effects of trade policies to show up in economic data — but acknowledge they aren’t sure how long.
title: Despite Dire Warnings, the Economy Is Holding Up. Can That Last?

author: Maya Phillips
description: There’s more than one way to play the most classic of superheroes. Here’s how six actors have approached the role.
title: Christopher Reeve to David Corenswet: The Actors Who Played Superman

author: Jeffrey Toobin
description: Trump wants his people calling the shots. And Bove has proved, above all, that he belongs to the president.
title: Revenge, Thy Name Is Emil Bove

author: Anna Peele
description: Ari Aster, the man behind some of Hollywood’s most unsettling films, takes his own anxiety and puts it onscreen.
title: Hollywood’s Master of Dread Is Afraid of … Everything

author: Jan Hoffman and Greta Rybus
description: Unlike with opioids, there is no medication to suppress cravings for meth and other stimulants. As use soars, hundreds of clinics are trying a radically different approach.
title: Upended by Meth, Some Communities Are Paying Users to Quit

author: Ed Shanahan
description: The City Council vote all but dooms the company’s chances of obtaining one of up to three casino licenses that New York State is expected to award this year.
title: Bally’s Bronx Casino Plan Appears Dead After Council Rejects Rezoning

author: Trish Bendix
description: People torched the hats in videos, apparently upset about the Jeffrey Epstein case. “People in China were like, ‘Oh, come on, we worked so hard making them,’” Fallon said.
title: Jimmy Fallon Fans the Flames of Burning MAGA Hats

author: Jack Healy
description: Adelita Grijalva beat back charges of “legacy” and embraced the memory of her father, Raúl Grijalva, to win the Democratic primary for the House seat opened by his death.
title: A Scion of Democratic Politics Defeats the Upstarts in an Arizona Primary

author: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Lauren Hirsch
description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee in the race for mayor of New York City, moved to distance himself from comments that sparked outrage during the primary.
title: Mamdani Says He Will ‘Discourage’ the Term ‘Globalize the Intifada’

author: Catie Edmondson
description: The vote to take up legislation to rescind $9 billion in funds Congress has already approved suggested that Republicans would bow to the president’s wishes in the simmering fight over spending powers.
title: Senate Advances Trump Clawback of Foreign Aid and Public Broadcast Funds

author: Jenna Russell
description: A former employee said she never saw the staff perform fire drills. The local fire chief pushed back at claims that dispatching more firefighters would’ve saved more lives.
title: Speculation Swirls After Deadly Fire at Massachusetts Assisted Living Facility

author: Megan Mineiro
description: The Republican senator introduced a bill Tuesday that would block restrictions on key strategies that states rely on to finance Medicaid and double a rural hospital fund.
title: Senator Hawley Aims to Roll Back Medicaid Cuts He Voted for in Trump Policy Bill
